initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".
stories: Police have sent an armoured vehicle to force open the door of a truck on a Texas highway after the driver refused to stop or exit the cab when officers used tire deflation devices to try and halt the vehicle. The pursuit began with the driver disregarding police orders, engaging in reckless driving tactics such as sudden lane changes and swerving. After the armoured vehicle shattered a window, police deployed a tear gas canister and then entered the vehicle to remove the driver. The motives behind the driver's erratic behavior remain unclear, although authorities suspect the driver may have been under the influence.

The pursuit commenced when the driver ignored police orders, engaging in reckless driving tactics including sudden lane changes and swerving. Following the armoured vehicle's shattering of a window, police deployed a tear gas canister and subsequently entered the vehicle to remove the driver. The reasons behind the driver's erratic behavior remain unclear, although authorities suspect the driver may have been intoxicated.
